structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines the grantha ID ('prashna-upanishad'), a slug from the commentator's name ('rangaramanuja'), and the zero-padded, hyphenated starting ID ('04-01') for a unique and sortable filename.

proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count
proposed_strategy.description: This strategy combines consecutive major structural units (Praśnas) into chunks, strictly ensuring no chunk exceeds the safety character limit. Since the provided text contains only a single Praśna and is very small, it is processed as one atomic chunk.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Praśna is primarily divided into sequentially numbered Mantras, which represent the smallest complete semantic units containing both the original text and its commentary.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral located between the double danda markers (।।...।।) at the end of the bolded mantra line.

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra begins with a bolded line containing the full Sanskrit text of the mantra, ending with its number enclosed in double dandas.
examples: **अथ हैनं सौर्यायणी गार्ग्य: पप्रच्छ । भगवन् ! एतस्मिन् पुरुषे कानि स्वपन्ति । कान्यस्मिन् जाग्रति । कतर एषः स्वप्नान् पश्यति । कस्यैतत् सुखं भवति । कस्मिन्नु सर्वे सम्प्रतिष्ठिता भवन्ति’ इति ।।१।।**
**प्राणाग्नय एव एतस्मिन् पुरे जाग्रति । गार्हपत्यो ह वा एषोऽपानः व्यानोऽन्वाहार्यपचन: यत् गार्हपत्यात् प्रणीयते, प्रणयनादाहवनीयः प्राणः ।। ३ ।।**

end_pattern.description: The commentary for a mantra implicitly ends where the next mantra's start pattern begins. The final mantra's commentary ends with the chapter colophon.
examples: **तस्मै स होवाच – यथा गार्ग्य ! ... स्वपिति इति आचक्षते ॥ २ ॥** (This start pattern marks the end of the previous mantra's section)
